comment_text:
I wonder how long it will be before Apple can sue for some sort of infringement. I'm sure they will take full advantage of the opportunity.

In any case, this seems to me like the worst time for Microsoft to start copying Apple. Everyone's been talking about how much Apple's software is declining and how their update strategy is pushing things too fast, making OS X updates released as soon as the new features are good enough to show off in a keynote.

Of course, when Apple stopped updating the major version number, they actually had a reason - new kernel, new base system, and tons of incompatible changes. Hopefully, Microsoft's focus on backwards compatibility will be enough to keep them from releasing the half-baked stuff that characterizes the current OS X.

My other worry with Windows is that it won't get updated. Windows updates, in a business environment especially, don't usually happen until they have to. And on a home computer, they will definitely need to copy Apple's price point too, because I definitely do not see most Windows users (who use it because of how many other people do, and don't pay extra for it; it's just the thing that came with their computer) upgrading every chance they get. Even if they do release upgrades for free, it will still take some marketing to get people to upgrade.

story_title: Microsoft to stop producing Windows versions
